match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 1 wicket (with 34 balls remaining)

image.caption: The magnificent Melbourne Cricket Ground in full bloom
image.longCaption: The magnificent Melbourne Cricket Ground in full bloom, Victoria v Queensland, FR Cup, MCG, February 6, 2008

match.hoursInfo: 14.20 start, First Session 14.20-17.50 Interval 17.50-18.35, Second Session 18.35-22.05

headshotImage.caption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Michael Hussey not out 71 (91b 1x4 0x6 144m) SR: 78.02
Brad Haddin c Dilshan b Perera 49 (55b 8x4 0x6 80m) SR: 89.09

dismissalComment.html: The pressure works! Murali's introduction has tied Australia down, and Perera has produced wicket-taking deliveries in back-to-back overs. This was short and wide all right, but got a bit big on Haddin, who had committed to the cut shot, and he failed to keep it down. Dilshan dives to his left at backward point to complete a regulation catch by his standards

top catch! Nice delivery too, moving away from back of a length, Clarke goes for an ill-advised cut, and gets a thick edge that is dying on Sangakkara, who dives in front and to his right, holds it one-handed, then gets the left hand over to control the ball even as he is tumbling over

The pressure works! Murali's introduction has tied Australia down, and Perera has produced wicket-taking deliveries in back-to-back overs. This was short and wide all right, but got a bit big on Haddin, who had committed to the cut shot, and he failed to keep it down. Dilshan dives to his left at backward point to complete a regulation catch by his standards

headshotImage.caption: Cameron White player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Cameron White player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: what a beaut! Ripper. Perera and Sri Lanka are on fire at the MCG. Another legcutter. He is on a hat-trick! Perfect delivery first up. Back of a length, pitching middle and off, cutting away, beating the poke, hitting the top of off

and Perera strikes almost immediately! He gas this knack of cutting the ball just enough. Lovely legcutter again. Short of a length, around off, making him play, then moving away enough to take the edge

headshotImage.caption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Michelle for Thisara! Hastings looks for the ramp shot, clearly not suited for that shot, doesn't get low, and Perera is full and straight and takes the prone middle stump. He is thrilled, raises his arms

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: again Sri Lanka break through just when Australia look to get on to a threatening partnership. Extra bounce for Randiv there. The ball is there to be cut, at least it seems so until it kicks and bounces, and takes a thick edge that Sanga hangs on to really well

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shane Watson c Silva b Malinga 10 (20b 0x4 0x6 28m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Malinga you beauty! Lovely slower ball. He has been troubling them with pace and bounce, and this is the first slower ball he has bowled. This pitches on a length, around leg stump, and Watson is way too early into the shot. The ball holds its line, and takes the leading edge that settles with midwicket. Sri Lankans are thrilled

dismissalText.commentary: Michael Clarke c †Sangakkara b Perera 27 (31b 3x4 0x6 41m) SR: 87.09

dismissalComment.html: top catch! Nice delivery too, moving away from back of a length, Clarke goes for an ill-advised cut, and gets a thick edge that is dying on Sangakkara, who dives in front and to his right, holds it one-handed, then gets the left hand over to control the ball even as he is tumbling over

dismissalText.commentary: Brad Haddin c Dilshan b Perera 49 (55b 8x4 0x6 80m) SR: 89.09

dismissalComment.html: The pressure works! Murali's introduction has tied Australia down, and Perera has produced wicket-taking deliveries in back-to-back overs. This was short and wide all right, but got a bit big on Haddin, who had committed to the cut shot, and he failed to keep it down. Dilshan dives to his left at backward point to complete a regulation catch by his standards

dismissalComment.html: and Perera strikes almost immediately! He gas this knack of cutting the ball just enough. Lovely legcutter again. Short of a length, around off, making him play, then moving away enough to take the edge

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell Johnson b Kulasekara 10 (17b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: bowled'im! Low full toss, nearly a yorker, Johnson plays across it, gets an inside edge onto the middle stump

headshotImage.longCaption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Michelle for Thisara! Hastings looks for the ramp shot, clearly not suited for that shot, doesn't get low, and Perera is full and straight and takes the prone middle stump. He is thrilled, raises his arms

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 77 (84b 8x4 1x6 127m) SR: 91.66
Lasith Malinga run out (Smith) 56 (48b 6x4 2x6 90m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: twist n the tail? Smith legendarily missed one run-out a few weeks ago, in Mohali, giving away four overthrows. This time, though, he hits the stumps direct, and catches Malinga short of a suicidal run. It was hit straight to him at cover. And they stopped and started too

Doherty strikes again after that crazy run-out! Mahela plays for the spin. This one doesn't. Caught dead in front. He is not pleased, he shouldn't be. The first ball hadn't turned either. He plays a forward defensive to this full delivery, and the ball goes with the arm, hitting him in front of middle

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Doherty is on fire here. Run-out, and then two wickets in two overs. And what a poor shot from Silva! Zero brains! Just dances down aimlessly and swings at a ball that is nowhere close to him. Watson back-pedals from mid-on and takes a safe catch. Will Sanga we left standing alone?

where were you hiding Xaveir Doherty? On a hat-trick in his second over. And this wicket could be the game. Sanga, who was batting so beautifully, looks for the paddle sweep, but this turns sharply from outside off, and kisses the leg stump. Done in by the break. Doherty is ecstatic, Sanga distraght
X-man has four! To go with that special run-out. Replay of Mahela dismissal. Stretching forward, defending for the turn, the ball goes straight on, would have missed both off and leg

Siddle comes back fast! Cramps him up on the short ball. Dilshan looks to pull it, but replays will tell him it is too full for the pull - pitched short of a length - and the tight line sort of cuffs him up. All he gets is a tame top edge that settles with Hussey, next to the square-leg umpire

headshotImage.caption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Hussey b Siddle 7 (6b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: Siddle comes back fast! Cramps him up on the short ball. Dilshan looks to pull it, but replays will tell him it is too full for the pull - pitched short of a length - and the tight line sort of cuffs him up. All he gets is a tame top edge that settles with Hussey, next to the square-leg umpire

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga run out (Doherty) 3 (18b 0x4 0x6 23m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: Doherty you beauty! X-man with X-factor! This was another beautiful punch shot from Sangakkara. Doherty dives full length to his left at mid-off. Tharanga had backed up too far. Who would blame him? This seemed headed for the mid-off boundary. And Doherty, during the act of getting back up, flicks the throw direct too. He loves his work, absolutely thrilled

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene lbw b Doherty 19 (27b 2x4 0x6 47m) SR: 70.37

dismissalComment.html: Doherty strikes again after that crazy run-out! Mahela plays for the spin. This one doesn't. Caught dead in front. He is not pleased, he shouldn't be. The first ball hadn't turned either. He plays a forward defensive to this full delivery, and the ball goes with the arm, hitting him in front of middle

headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva c Watson b Doherty 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Doherty is on fire here. Run-out, and then two wickets in two overs. And what a poor shot from Silva! Zero brains! Just dances down aimlessly and swings at a ball that is nowhere close to him. Watson back-pedals from mid-on and takes a safe catch. Will Sanga we left standing alone?

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara b Doherty 49 (46b 6x4 0x6 69m) SR: 106.52

dismissalComment.html: where were you hiding Xaveir Doherty? On a hat-trick in his second over. And this wicket could be the game. Sanga, who was batting so beautifully, looks for the paddle sweep, but this turns sharply from outside off, and kisses the leg stump. Done in by the break. Doherty is ecstatic, Sanga distraght

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera b Johnson 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: slight swing for Johnson. Bowled'im. More so pace than swing. Perera is backing away. Not wanting to get too close to its line. Misses the full and straight delivery, which holds its line a touch, and takes the off stump

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suraj Randiv run out (Hussey/sub [MA Starc]/Smith) 10 (21b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 47.61

dismissalComment.html: nice shot, half-volley all right, but he has chipped it over extra cover. Hang on, though. There is drama. Run-out! Good work from Smith. Randiv is coming back for the third, the relay throw from Mitchell Starc (substitute) is a bit wide, Smith collects it one-handed and removes the bails in a flash, to beat Randiv's dive by a frame. I am sure that one-handed collection made this run-out possible

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara lbw b Doherty 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: X-man has four! To go with that special run-out. Replay of Mahela dismissal. Stretching forward, defending for the turn, the ball goes straight on, would have missed both off and leg

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga run out (Smith) 56 (48b 6x4 2x6 90m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: twist n the tail? Smith legendarily missed one run-out a few weeks ago, in Mohali, giving away four overthrows. This time, though, he hits the stumps direct, and catches Malinga short of a suicidal run. It was hit straight to him at cover. And they stopped and started too

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: Murali has done it! Malinga is ecstatic. Runs onto the field. Not a great delivery. Sliding down the leg side, and Murali flicks it fine of short fine. Murali exults too. Mathews is cool. He was cool throughout

commentPostTextItems.html: What a finish. I never thought I would be saying these words, but Australia could have choked here. They last won a game in July. They had the Sri Lankan batsmen playing without using their brains, and had 132 to defend with those last two wickets remaining. Then Sri Lanka took the Powerplay and set the cat among the pigeons. They batted incredibly since then, a mix of slogs, and classical hitting. Mathews's aerial drives, after charging down to fast bowlers, were ones for the albums. Don't forget the contribution from the other half of the Josephian Mafia: Thisara Perera bowled splendidly to take five wickets. He did what the Aussie bowlers didn't do: move the old ball off the straight. And finally, what a week it has been for the good-old 50-over cricket. There is life in the old dog yet. Do read Brydon Coverdale's Bulletin. Until Sydney, then, cheers
Angelo Mathews is MoM He says, "I am still catching my breath All credit must go to Lasith. Batting was so easy then."
Sanga: "Angelo and Lasith were unbelievable. He is the greatest asset we have had over the last year. He can bowl, he can bat, total champion. He is still 21, 22."

Michael Clarke "Tough day in the office. 8 for 107. I honestly don't know how we lost this game. I thought we could have done better with the bat, but from 8 for 107... Having said that, full credit must go to Sri Lanka. Mathews played a fantastic innings, and we just couldnt' stop Malinga. Mohali didn't come to my mind, certainly not. I tried to bowl almost everyone. Steven Smith hurt his back, so couldn't bring him back. In tried everything. Have you any tips?"
Mark Nicholas says, "Bowl yourself more often."
What an image. Murali leaping six feet high in the air, and Watson in the same frame looking to the heavens. Sums up the emotions.

Australia have been blown away here by this partnership. They are stunned. Not sure they quite know what hit them. Malinga can't stop grinning. Out come Sanga, Mahela, the rest of the team. Champaka Ramanayake, too, Malinga's mentor, but with the ball, mind you.
"The way Lasith batted was excellent," says Angelo.
"We were eight down, we knew there was no point hanging around," says Lasith.
"Mitchell was bowling really well, so I kept strike against him," says Angelo.

commentPreTextItems.html: Watson to bowl. Everybody saving single

commentTextItems.html: defended to point. Mathews has the stakes on. Murali keeps his head and sends him back. There was no way there was a run here

commentPreTextItems.html: they are going to take one now, surely?

commentTextItems.html: Goes for the big shot, gets an inside edge towards short fine. They decide against the single. Murali will have to face

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Out comes Murali. Will there be a tie?

commentTextItems.html: forward defensive. Doubts in SL minds now

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga run out (Smith) 56 (48b 6x4 2x6 90m) SR: 116.66

commentTextItems.html: twist n the tail? Smith legendarily missed one run-out a few weeks ago, in Mohali, giving away four overthrows. This time, though, he hits the stumps direct, and catches Malinga short of a suicidal run. It was hit straight to him at cover. And they stopped and started too
flat-batted to mid-on, they think of one, don't take it
scores are level, coolly he has forced this shortish delivery past point. Melbourne is like Colombo today. There is blue all ever at the G

commentPreTextItems.html: captain comes. Clarke. One slip waits

commentTextItems.html: tosses this up, teases, Malinga slogs, gets an inside edge, and a single

shot! Angelo is finishing this off. Hit over wide mid-on. Length ball, gets to front foot and clears the ring easily. Highest ninth-wicket partnership. Ever. Beating Kapil and Kirmani's 126 from WC 1983, when Kapil scored 175

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: full, stays back, places it wide of mid-on

What. A. Strike. Nerves? What nerves? He is striking it as if playing in a neighbourhood game in Rathgama. Makes room, lofts this length ball over Watson's head. One bounce for four. Less than 10 required now
left alone also now
angled into the pads, worked around the corner comfortably, scrambles back for two. Fifty for Malinga! I dare anybody to wipe that smile off his face in this moment. Sri Lanka flags all around
length ball, pushed down to long-off for one. Mathews doesn't mind exposing Malinga to Watson

commentPreTextItems.html: Last ball... where is the single coming?

commentTextItems.html: to square leg, easily done, not sure if Malinga on strike gives them that much greater a chance for a wicket

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: and suddenly he slogs, but it goes along the ground to short midwicket

Angelooooo! whaddaplayaaaaa! Beautiful shot. Classical inside-out shot upon having charged down the wicket. Except it is against Johnson bowling at 140kmph. What a clean strike, over long-off. Only 16 required
slower ball, around off, Mathews defends off the front foot
refuses the single off Johnson. Shades of Laxman there?
inches from getting out. Doherty nearly pulls off another screamer. Hit loopily wide of extra cover. Doherty takes two steps, then dives full length, but it evades him

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shane Watson c Silva b Malinga 10 (20b 0x4 0x6 28m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Malinga you beauty! Lovely slower ball. He has been troubling them with pace and bounce, and this is the first slower ball he has bowled. This pitches on a length, around leg stump, and Watson is way too early into the shot. The ball holds its line, and takes the leading edge that settles with midwicket. Sri Lankans are thrilled

dismissalText.commentary: Michael Clarke c †Sangakkara b Perera 27 (31b 3x4 0x6 41m) SR: 87.09

dismissalComment.html: top catch! Nice delivery too, moving away from back of a length, Clarke goes for an ill-advised cut, and gets a thick edge that is dying on Sangakkara, who dives in front and to his right, holds it one-handed, then gets the left hand over to control the ball even as he is tumbling over

dismissalText.commentary: Brad Haddin c Dilshan b Perera 49 (55b 8x4 0x6 80m) SR: 89.09

dismissalComment.html: The pressure works! Murali's introduction has tied Australia down, and Perera has produced wicket-taking deliveries in back-to-back overs. This was short and wide all right, but got a bit big on Haddin, who had committed to the cut shot, and he failed to keep it down. Dilshan dives to his left at backward point to complete a regulation catch by his standards

headshotImage.caption: Cameron White player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Cameron White player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Cameron White player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Cameron White player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Cameron White b Perera 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: what a beaut! Ripper. Perera and Sri Lanka are on fire at the MCG. Another legcutter. He is on a hat-trick! Perfect delivery first up. Back of a length, pitching middle and off, cutting away, beating the poke, hitting the top of off

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Marsh c †Sangakkara b Randiv 31 (53b 0x4 0x6 57m) SR: 58.49

dismissalComment.html: again Sri Lanka break through just when Australia look to get on to a threatening partnership. Extra bounce for Randiv there. The ball is there to be cut, at least it seems so until it kicks and bounces, and takes a thick edge that Sanga hangs on to really well

dismissalText.commentary: Steven Smith c †Sangakkara b Perera 12 (15b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: and Perera strikes almost immediately! He gas this knack of cutting the ball just enough. Lovely legcutter again. Short of a length, around off, making him play, then moving away enough to take the edge

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell Johnson b Kulasekara 10 (17b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: bowled'im! Low full toss, nearly a yorker, Johnson plays across it, gets an inside edge onto the middle stump

headshotImage.caption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: John Hastings player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: John Hastings b Perera 16 (15b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 106.66

dismissalComment.html: Michelle for Thisara! Hastings looks for the ramp shot, clearly not suited for that shot, doesn't get low, and Perera is full and straight and takes the prone middle stump. He is thrilled, raises his arms

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga run out (Doherty) 3 (18b 0x4 0x6 23m) SR: 16.66

dismissalComment.html: Doherty you beauty! X-man with X-factor! This was another beautiful punch shot from Sangakkara. Doherty dives full length to his left at mid-off. Tharanga had backed up too far. Who would blame him? This seemed headed for the mid-off boundary. And Doherty, during the act of getting back up, flicks the throw direct too. He loves his work, absolutely thrilled

headshotImage.caption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Hussey b Siddle 7 (6b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: Siddle comes back fast! Cramps him up on the short ball. Dilshan looks to pull it, but replays will tell him it is too full for the pull - pitched short of a length - and the tight line sort of cuffs him up. All he gets is a tame top edge that settles with Hussey, next to the square-leg umpire

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara b Doherty 49 (46b 6x4 0x6 69m) SR: 106.52

dismissalComment.html: where were you hiding Xaveir Doherty? On a hat-trick in his second over. And this wicket could be the game. Sanga, who was batting so beautifully, looks for the paddle sweep, but this turns sharply from outside off, and kisses the leg stump. Done in by the break. Doherty is ecstatic, Sanga distraght

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene lbw b Doherty 19 (27b 2x4 0x6 47m) SR: 70.37

dismissalComment.html: Doherty strikes again after that crazy run-out! Mahela plays for the spin. This one doesn't. Caught dead in front. He is not pleased, he shouldn't be. The first ball hadn't turned either. He plays a forward defensive to this full delivery, and the ball goes with the arm, hitting him in front of middle

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva c Watson b Doherty 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Doherty is on fire here. Run-out, and then two wickets in two overs. And what a poor shot from Silva! Zero brains! Just dances down aimlessly and swings at a ball that is nowhere close to him. Watson back-pedals from mid-on and takes a safe catch. Will Sanga we left standing alone?

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 77 (84b 8x4 1x6 127m) SR: 91.66
Thisara Perera b Johnson 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: slight swing for Johnson. Bowled'im. More so pace than swing. Perera is backing away. Not wanting to get too close to its line. Misses the full and straight delivery, which holds its line a touch, and takes the off stump

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Hussey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suraj Randiv run out (Hussey/sub [MA Starc]/Smith) 10 (21b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 47.61

dismissalComment.html: nice shot, half-volley all right, but he has chipped it over extra cover. Hang on, though. There is drama. Run-out! Good work from Smith. Randiv is coming back for the third, the relay throw from Mitchell Starc (substitute) is a bit wide, Smith collects it one-handed and removes the bails in a flash, to beat Randiv's dive by a frame. I am sure that one-handed collection made this run-out possible

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara lbw b Doherty 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: X-man has four! To go with that special run-out. Replay of Mahela dismissal. Stretching forward, defending for the turn, the ball goes straight on, would have missed both off and leg

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga run out (Smith) 56 (48b 6x4 2x6 90m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: twist n the tail? Smith legendarily missed one run-out a few weeks ago, in Mohali, giving away four overthrows. This time, though, he hits the stumps direct, and catches Malinga short of a suicidal run. It was hit straight to him at cover. And they stopped and started too

headshotImage.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Muthiah Muralidaran not out 4 (2b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: slight swing for Johnson. Bowled'im. More so pace than swing. Perera is backing away. Not wanting to get too close to its line. Misses the full and straight delivery, which holds its line a touch, and takes the off stump

Siddle comes back fast! Cramps him up on the short ball. Dilshan looks to pull it, but replays will tell him it is too full for the pull - pitched short of a length - and the tight line sort of cuffs him up. All he gets is a tame top edge that settles with Hussey, next to the square-leg umpire

Power Play 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0
Australia: 50 runs in 10.3 overs (63 balls), Extras 0
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 59 balls (BJ Haddin 27, MJ Clarke 23, Ex 1)
Drinks: Australia - 85/2 in 16.5 overs (BJ Haddin 47)
Australia: 100 runs in 22.3 overs (135 balls), Extras 1
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 76 balls (MEK Hussey 22, SE Marsh 26, Ex 2)
Australia: 150 runs in 33.6 overs (206 balls), Extras 3
Drinks: Australia - 155/5 in 35.2 overs (MEK Hussey 34)
MEK Hussey: 50 off 71 balls (1 x 4)
Power Play 3: Overs 44.1 - 49.0
Australia: 200 runs in 44.2 overs (269 balls), Extras 5
Innings Break: Australia - 239/8 in 50.0 overs (MEK Hussey 71, XJ Doherty 3)
Sri Lanka innings
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 8.3 overs (52 balls), Extras 1
Power Play 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 55 balls (KC Sangakkara 31, DPMD Jayawardene 18, Ex 1)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 73/3 in 15.2 overs (KC Sangakkara 43)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 23.3 overs (145 balls), Extras 4
Power Play 3: Overs 26.1 - 31.0
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 30.1 overs (187 balls), Extras 6
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 156/8 in 31.0 overs (AD Mathews 37, SL Malinga 21)
9th Wicket: 50 runs in 37 balls (AD Mathews 27, SL Malinga 21, Ex 2)
AD Mathews: 50 off 61 balls (5 x 4)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 37.3 overs (235 balls), Extras 12
9th Wicket: 100 runs in 90 balls (AD Mathews 45, SL Malinga 46, Ex 9)
SL Malinga: 50 off 42 balls (5 x 4, 2 x 6)

milestones.description: Malinga and Angelo Mathews's 132-run partnership is SL's highest for the 9th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 76 between Ruwan Kalpage and Chaminda Vaas
Malinga and Angelo Mathews's 132-run partnership is the highest for the 9th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 126 between Syed Kirmani and Kapil Dev

stories.title: Australia forget how to win
stories.subTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne
stories.seoTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka: Australia forget how to win
stories.summary: The word 'choke' was not uttered when Michael Clarke answered questions about Australia's scarcely believable defeat at the hands of Sri Lanka

image.caption: Xavier Doherty had a debut to remember
image.longCaption: Xavier Doherty had a debut to remember, Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne, November 3, 2010

stories.title: Sangakkara savours stunning comeback
stories.subTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne
stories.seoTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka: Kumar Sangakkara savours stunning comeback
stories.summary: Kumar Sangakkara is not a man to indulge in hyperbole, but even he rated Sri Lanka's miraculous comeback win at the MCG as one of the two best victories in his 277-game career

image.caption: Angelo Mathews launches one down the ground
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews launches one down the ground, Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne, November 3, 2010

stories.title: Mathews and Malinga script stunning victory
stories.subTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne
stories.seoTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne: Angelo Mathews and Lasith Malinga script stunning victory
stories.summary: Thisara Perera's five-wicket haul ensured Australia's total wasn't too imposing but Michael Hussey at least gave the hosts a competitive score, and eased a small amount of the pressure on him in the lead-up to the Ashes
stories.byline: The Bulletin by Brydon Coverdale at the MCG

image.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan and Angelo Mathews react as Sri Lanka cross the finish line
image.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan and Angelo Mathews react as Sri Lanka cross the finish line, Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne, November 3, 2010

stories.title: Ponting backs out-of-form Hussey to bounce back
stories.subTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne
stories.seoTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne: Ricky Ponting backs Michael Hussey to bounce back
stories.summary: Michael Hussey will walk on to the MCG on Wednesday under immense pressure ahead of the Ashes, but his captain Ricky Ponting believes Hussey will come good before the first Test

image.caption: Michael Hussey walks off after being dismissed for 3
image.longCaption: Michael Hussey walks off after being dismissed for 3, South Australia v Western Australia, Sheffield Shield, Adelaide, 4th day, November 1, 2010

stories.title: Sangakkara quietly confident ahead of ODIs
stories.subTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne
stories.seoTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne: Kumar Sangakkara quietly confident ahead of ODIs
stories.summary: Kumar Sangakkara knows his side has the momentum and he is aware Australia are struggling, but he is not getting carried away with the idea of leading Sri Lanka to their first series victory in Australia`

image.caption: Kumar Sangakkara and his team-mates on top of Sydney Harbour Bridge
image.longCaption: Kumar Sangakkara and his team-mates on top of Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney, October 26, 2010

stories.title: Ponting to miss first ODI against Sri Lanka
stories.subTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne
stories.seoTitle: Australia v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Melbourne: Ricky Ponting to miss first ODI
stories.summary: Ricky Ponting will miss Australia's first one-day international against Sri Lanka in Melbourne on Wednesday after the death of his grandmother in Tasmania
